programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.sub-title: Des artistes, des créateurs, immersion dans la nature
programme.desc: Of artists and designers, an immersion in nature The corm is the fruit of the service tree, Éric Bordelet explains how he turns it into a French drink called "cormé". Just opposite the Sacré-Coeur in Paris, Europe's largest city farm is starting to come into being. Visiting the Parc de Sceaux. Don't panic: Leïla and Thierry's garden. Presented by: Stéphane Marie, Carole Tolila.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: Min Teke After two nights of high-altitude camping, the group and their guide Caroline, attack the second part of the ascent to the summit of Min Teke. 900 metres of climbing on an ice wall and snow-covered cliff-faces. Directed by: Martin Schilt (Switzerland, 2020)

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Season 7, episode 5:

Spotlight on the paper creations by Marianne Guély. All you need to know about red heels. Working with wood, brass, leather, ivory and eggshell: an in-depth look at the craftsmanship of Atelier d'Art Walser. How to wear a Peter Pan collar. Mélissa Serror reinvents vintage jewellery with Sigal Paris.

Commentary by: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc:
Éric Pras (1/2)
Land of gastronomy and wine-growing par excellence, Burgundy immerses us in a wealth of taste and flavour, all accompanied by Éric Pras. Veritable ambassador for his region, the three Michelin-starred chef takes us on a voyage from Chagny to Dijon, in the footsteps of talented chefs and passionate producers.
Presented by: Emmanuelle Delteil.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life as a couple aboard a yacht On the Gaspé Peninsula, Julien meets Marie-Pier and Adrien, two thirty-somethings who sold everything to buy a sailing boat and live on it full-time. They also set up a sailing school, La Belle Vie Sailing. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: The secret behind-the-scenes world of the mediaeval Château de Roquetaillade. Discovering the chic eco-friendly universe of Marie-France de Crécy, textile designer and artist, who brings poetry to recycling. A journey in the footsteps of Coluche. Cards, notebooks, posters, bookmarks, invitations... In Paris, Letterpress uses all the expertise of old-fashioned printing. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.sub-title: En avant, les matières premières végétales
programme.desc: Raw materials from plants Cabinetmaker, professional designer, Franck Grossel, gives a second life to an unusual material: draff, spent cereal, a by-product from brewing. Less polluting and less toxic, all the latest developments in using plants for insulation. Visiting the camellia fields of Gaujacq. Don't panic: return to Laurette's garden. Presented by: Stéphane Marie, Carole Tolila.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: The steepest face in the valley The young mountaineers teach the Kyrgyz guides their Alpine climbing techniques then divide into two teams. Whilst Anne and Ramona return to the heights, the others test their skills by climbing the valley's highest cliff face. Directed by: Martin Schilt (Switzerland, 2020)

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Season 7, episode 6:

Spotlight on French-style gastronomy and high-end dining thanks to tableware from the Sèvres Manufactory. How to wear a cap backwards and pastel colours. Parisian blazers by Capucine Martin. In Strasbourg, the Au Fond du Jardin tea rooms have made the madeleine its speciality, and offer a surprising range.

Commentary by: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc:
Éric Pras (2/2)
In the company of the Burgundy chef Éric Pras, we discover one of France's most emblematic wine-growing areas. An opportunity to follow a culinary trail that continues in Dijon, in the heart of the International Centre for Gastronomy and Wine, and witness a "battle" between two exceptional young chefs.
Presented by: Emmanuelle Delteil.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life on a smallholding In Alberta, Roger and Virginie live on their smallholding with their three children. The couple like keeping certain traditions alive, such as bringing in the hay, and rope Julien in to lend a hand. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Exploring Saint-Émilion, South-West France. An artist in every sense taking her inspiration from nature, Daniela Busarello is architect, designer, painter, scenographer and landscape designer. Paris, in the footsteps of a French icon: Edith Piaf. Focus on vegetable dyeing by Caroline Courtois. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Vachement Normand !
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Cranberry-cinnamon brioche
To highlight the arrival at the newsagents of the Christmas magazine, Ricardo prepares the recipe that features on the cover: a festive cranberry-cinnamon brioche wreath.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc:
Sept-Îles, protecting the seabirds
Just offshore from Brittany's Côte de Granit Rose, the Sept-Îles archipelago is a nature reserve that offers a safe haven for the largest population of seabirds in metropolitan France. No easy matter, when we know that between 1950 and 2010, the global seabird population declined by nearly 70%. Report by: Corentin Pichon.
Presented by: Marine Barnérias.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Renaissance Château de Cadillac, Gironde. Encounter with the architect and designer Sophie Dries, for an enchanting journey to the heart of materials and know-how. A theatre-themed exploration of Paris. Focus on Mathon and its jewellers; craftsmen and women whose every gesture is precise and precious. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.sub-title: Risotto bianco et risotto à la betterave
programme.desc: Risotto bianco and beetroot risotto Caroline Dumas cooks a risotto bianco, and offers a range of different additions, and also presents a beetroot risotto. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Bordeaux court of appeal. Textile designer Sophie Mallebranche weaves metal thread using innovative industrial techniques. Discovering the Paris of the workers. A poetic stroll in the area around Rouen, where the porcelain sculptures by the ceramist Marik Korus take the colour white to another level. Presented by: Katherina Marx.
